pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.1.eng: On one occasion when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo senāya abbhuyyāto hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.2.eng: King Pasenadi of Kosala was marching out with the army,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.3.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū uyyuttaṃ senaṃ dassanāya agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.3.eng: and the monks from the group of six went to see it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.4.pli: Addasā kho rājā pasenadi kosalo chabbaggiye bhikkhū dūratova āgacchante.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.4.eng: When King Pasenadi saw the monks coming,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.7.eng: “We wish to see the great king.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.8.eng: “What’s the use of seeing me finding pleasure in battle?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.10.eng: And people complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā uyyuttaṃ senaṃ dassanāya āgacchissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.11.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics go to see the army?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.12.pli: Amhākampi alābhā, amhākampi dulladdhaṃ, ye mayaṃ ājīvassa hetu puttadārassa kāraṇā senāya āgacchāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.12.eng: It’s our misfortune that we must go out with the army for the sake of our livelihoods and because of our wives and children.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.13.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.13.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.14.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.14.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.15.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū uyyuttaṃ senaṃ dassanāya gacchissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.15.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six go to see the army?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.16.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, uyyuttaṃ senaṃ dassanāya gacchathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.16.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.19.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, uyyuttaṃ senaṃ dassanāya gacchissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.19.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.21.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.21.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.22.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu uyyuttaṃ senaṃ dassanāya gaccheyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.22.1.eng: ‘If a monk goes to see an army, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.23.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.23.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno mātulo senāya gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards a certain monk had a sick uncle in the army.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.2.pli: So tassa bhikkhuno santike dūtaṃ pāhesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.2.eng: The uncle sent a message to that monk:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.3.eng: “I’m with the army and I’m sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.6.pli: Atha kho tassa bhikkhuno etadahosi—“bhagavatā sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ—‘na uyyuttaṃ senaṃ dassanāya gantabban’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.6.eng: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against going to see an army, that monk thought,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.7.eng: “I have a sick uncle in the army.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.10.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.10.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.11.eng: “Monks, I allow you to go to the army when there’s a suitable reason.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.12.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.12.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.13.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu uyyuttaṃ senaṃ dassanāya gaccheyya, aññatra tathārūpappaccayā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.13.1.eng: ‘If a monk goes to see an army, except if there is a suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.13.1.comm: “Army” renders uyyutta sena, which might be rendered “a mobilized army”. At the time of the Buddha it seems armies consisted entirely of reserve troops that would then be mobilized at times of war. With the advent of professional armies, however, armies are always more or less mobilized. Thus my rendering.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.6.pli: gāmato nikkhamitvā niviṭṭhā vā hoti payātā vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.6.eng: it has left the inhabited area and is either encamped or marching.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.9.pli: Dvādasapuriso hatthī, tipuriso asso, catupuriso ratho, cattāro purisā sarahatthā patti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.9.eng: An elephant has twelve men; a horse has three men; a chariot has four men; an infantry unit has four men with arrows in hand.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.10.eng: If he is on his way to see it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.11.eng: Wherever he stands to see it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.12.pli: Dassanūpacāraṃ vijahitvā punappunaṃ passati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.12.eng: Every time he goes beyond the range of sight and then sees it again, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.13.eng: Except if there is a suitable reason:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.14.eng: unless there is a suitable reason.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.1.pli: Uyyutte uyyuttasaññī dassanāya gacchati, aññatra tathārūpappaccayā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.1.eng: If it is an army, and he perceives it as such, and he goes to see it, except if there is a suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.2.pli: Uyyutte vematiko dassanāya gacchati, aññatra tathārūpappaccayā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.2.eng: If it is an army, but he is unsure of it, and he goes to see it, except if there is a suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.3.pli: Uyyutte anuyyuttasaññī dassanāya gacchati, aññatra tathārūpappaccayā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.3.eng: If it is an army, but he does not perceive it as such, and he goes to see it, except if there is a suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.4.eng: If he is on his way to see one division of a fourfold army, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.5.eng: Wherever he stands to see it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.6.pli: Dassanūpacāraṃ vijahitvā punappunaṃ passati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.6.eng: Every time he goes beyond the range of sight and then sees it again, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.7.eng: If it is not an army, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.8.eng: If it is not an army, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.9.eng: If it is not an army, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.3.2.eng: if he sees it while standing in a monastery;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.3.3.pli: bhikkhussa ṭhitokāsaṃ vā nisinnokāsaṃ vā nipannokāsaṃ vā āgacchati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.3.3.eng: if the army comes to where the monk is standing, sitting, or lying down;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.3.4.eng: if he sees it while walking in the opposite direction;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.3.5.eng: if he has a suitable reason;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.3.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.3.9.eng: The training rule on armies, the eighth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:0.5.eng: 49. The training rule on staying with armies

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.1.eng: On one occasion when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sati karaṇīye senaṃ gantvā atirekatirattaṃ senāya vasanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six went to the army on some business, and they stayed there for more than three nights.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.4.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics stay with the army?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.5.pli: Amhākampi alābhā, amhākampi dulladdhaṃ, ye mayaṃ ājīvassa hetu puttadārassa kāraṇā senāya paṭivasāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.5.eng: It’s our misfortune that we must stay with the army for the sake of our livelihoods and because of our wives and children.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.6.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.6.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.7.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū atirekatirattaṃ senāya vasissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.8.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six stay with the army for more than three nights?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, atirekatirattaṃ senāya vasathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, atirekatirattaṃ senāya vasissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.12.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.14.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.15.1.pli: “Siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno kocideva paccayo senaṃ gamanāya, dirattatirattaṃ tena bhikkhunā senāya vasitabbaṃ. Tato ce uttari vaseyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.15.1.eng: ‘If that monk has a reason for going to the army, he may stay with the army for two or three nights. If he stays longer than that, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.1.pli: Siyā ca tassa bhikkhuno kocideva paccayo senaṃ gamanāyāti
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.1.eng: If that monk has a reason for going to the army:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.2.eng: if he has a reason, if he has something to  do.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.3.eng: He may stay with the army for two or three nights:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.4.eng: he may stay for two or for three nights.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.5.eng: If he stays longer than that:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.6.pli: catutthe divase atthaṅgate sūriye senāya vasati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.6.eng: if he is staying with the army at sunset on the fourth day, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.1.pli: Atirekatiratte atirekasaññī senāya vasati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.1.eng: If it is more than three nights, and he perceives it as more, and he is staying with the army, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.2.pli: Atirekatiratte vematiko senāya vasati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.2.eng: If it is more than three nights, but he is unsure of it, and he is staying with the army, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.3.pli: Atirekatiratte ūnakasaññī senāya vasati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.3.eng: If it is more than three nights, but he perceives it as less, and he is staying with the army, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.4.eng: If it is less than three nights, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.5.eng: If it is less than three nights, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.6.eng: If it is less than three nights, and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.2.eng: if he stays for two or three nights;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.3.eng: if he stays for less than two or three nights;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.4.pli: dve rattiyo vasitvā tatiyāya rattiyā purāruṇā nikkhamitvā puna vasati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.4.eng: if he stays for two nights, then leaves before dawn on the third night, and then stays again;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.5.eng: if he stays because he is sick;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.6.eng: if he stays because he has to take care of someone who is sick;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.7.eng: if the army is obstructed by an enemy army;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.8.eng: if he is obstructed from leaving;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.11.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.12.eng: The training rule on staying with armies, the ninth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:0.5.eng: 5. The training rule on the same sleeping place

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā āḷaviyaṃ viharati aggāḷave cetiye.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Āḷavī at the Aggāḷava Shrine.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena upāsakā ārāmaṃ āgacchanti dhammassavanāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.2.eng: At that time the lay followers were coming to the monastery to listen to the Teaching.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.3.pli: Dhamme bhāsite therā bhikkhū yathāvihāraṃ gacchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.3.eng: When the instruction was over, the senior monks went to their own dwellings,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.4.pli: Navakā bhikkhū tattheva upaṭṭhānasālāyaṃ upāsakehi saddhiṃ muṭṭhassatī, asampajānā, naggā, vikūjamānā, kākacchamānā seyyaṃ kappenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.4.eng: but the newly ordained monks lay down right there in the assembly hall together with the lay followers—absentminded, heedless, naked, muttering, and snoring.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.5.eng: The lay followers complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhadantā muṭṭhassatī asampajānā naggā vikūjamānā kākacchamānā seyyaṃ kappessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.6.eng: “How can the venerables lie down absentminded, heedless, naked, muttering, and snoring?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.7.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ upāsakānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.7.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those lay followers,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.8.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.8.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.9.eng: “How can monks lie down in the same sleeping place as people who are not fully ordained?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.10.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū te navake bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.10.eng: After rebuking those newly ordained monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.11.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū anupasampannena sahaseyyaṃ kappentī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.11.eng: “Is it true, monks, that monks did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.14.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā anupasampannena sahaseyyaṃ kappessanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.14.eng: “How could those foolish men do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.16.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.16.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.17.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu anupasampannena sahaseyyaṃ kappeyya pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.17.1.eng: ‘If a monk lies down in the same sleeping place as a person who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.18.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:1.18.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āḷaviyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena kosambī tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.1.eng: After staying at Āḷavī for as long as he wanted, the Buddha set out wandering toward Kosambī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena kosambī tadavasari. Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati badarikārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.2.eng: When he eventually arrived, he stayed at the Badarikā Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.3.eng: Just then the monks there said to Venerable Rāhula,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.4.pli: “bhagavatā, āvuso rāhula, sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ—‘na anupasampannena sahaseyyā kappetabbā’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.4.eng: “Rāhula, the Buddha has laid down a training rule that we can’t lie down in the same sleeping place as a person who’s not fully ordained.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.6.pli: Atha kho āyasmā rāhulo seyyaṃ alabhamāno vaccakuṭiyā seyyaṃ kappesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.6.eng: Since Rāhula was not able to find a sleeping place, he lay down in the restroom.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya yena vaccakuṭi tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ukkāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.7.eng: Then, after rising early in the morning, the Buddha went to the restroom where he cleared his throat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.12.pli: Atha kho āyasmā rāhulo bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.12.eng: Rāhula told the Buddha what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.13.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.14.eng: “Monks, I allow you to lie down in the same sleeping place as a person who isn’t fully ordained for two or three nights.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.15.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.15.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.16.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu anupasampannena uttaridirattatirattaṃ sahaseyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:2.16.1.eng: ‘If a monk lies down more than two or three nights in the same sleeping place as a person who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.5.eng: A person who is not fully ordained:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.6.eng: anyone except a fully ordained monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.7.eng: More than two or three nights:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.8.eng: in excess of two or three nights.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.12.eng: fully roofed, fully walled; mostly roofed, mostly walled.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.13.eng: Lies down in the same sleeping place:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.14.pli: catutthe divase atthaṅgate sūriye, anupasampanne nipanne, bhikkhu nipajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.14.eng: at dawn on the fourth day: if he lies down when the person who is not fully ordained is already lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.15.pli: Bhikkhu nipanne, anupasampanno nipajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.15.eng: if the person who is not fully ordained lies down when he is already lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.16.eng: if they both lie down together, he commits an offense entailing confession;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.1.17.eng: every time they get up and then lie down again, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.1.pli: Anupasampanne anupasampannasaññī uttaridirattatirattaṃ sahaseyyaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.1.eng: If they are not fully ordained, and the monk does not perceive them as such, and he lies down more than two or three nights in the same sleeping place as them, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.2.pli: Anupasampanne vematiko uttaridirattatirattaṃ sahaseyyaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.2.eng: If they are not fully ordained, but the monk is unsure of it, and he lies down more than two or three nights in the same sleeping place as them, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.3.pli: Anupasampanne upasampannasaññī uttaridirattatirattaṃ sahaseyyaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.3.eng: If they are is not fully ordained, but the monk perceives them as such, and he lies down more than two or three nights in the same sleeping place as them, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.4.eng: If it is half-roofed and half-walled, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.5.eng: If they are fully ordained, but the monk does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.6.eng: If they are fully ordained, but the monk is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.2.7.eng: If they are fully ordained, and the monk perceives them as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.2.eng: if he stays together with them for two or three nights;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.3.eng: if he stays together with them for less than two or three nights;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.4.pli: dve rattiyo vasitvā tatiyāya rattiyā purāruṇā nikkhamitvā puna vasati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.4.eng: if, after staying together for two nights, he leaves before dawn on the third night and then stays together again;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.5.eng: if it is fully roofed, but not walled;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.6.eng: if it is fully walled, but not roofed;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.7.eng: if it is mostly not roofed;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.8.eng: if it is mostly not walled;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.9.eng: if the monk sits when the person who is not fully ordained is lying down;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.10.eng: if the person who is not fully ordained sits when the monk is lying down;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.13.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc5:3.3.14.eng: The training rule on the same sleeping place, the fifth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.1.eng: On one occasion when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū dirattatirattaṃ senāya vasamānā uyyodhikampi balaggampi senābyūhampi anīkadassanampi gacchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six were staying with the army for two or three nights. They went to see battles, troop reviews, the massing of the army, and troop inspections.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.3.pli: Aññataropi chabbaggiyo bhikkhu uyyodhikaṃ gantvā kaṇḍena paṭividdho hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.3.eng: One of the monks who went to a battle was struck by an arrow.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.5.pli: “kacci, bhante, suyuddhaṃ ahosi, kati te lakkhāni laddhānī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.5.eng: “We hope you had a good battle, venerable. How many targets did you hit?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.6.pli: So bhikkhu tehi manussehi uppaṇḍiyamāno maṅku ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.6.eng: And because they teased him, he felt humiliated.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.7.eng: People complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā uyyodhikaṃ dassanāya āgacchissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.8.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics go to see a battle?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.9.pli: Amhākampi alābhā, amhākampi dulladdhaṃ, ye mayaṃ ājīvassa hetu puttadārassa kāraṇā uyyodhikaṃ āgacchāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.9.eng: It’s our misfortune that we must go to battles for the sake of our livelihoods and because of our wives and children.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.10.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.10.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.11.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.11.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.12.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū uyyodhikaṃ dassanāya gacchissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.12.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six go to see a battle?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.13.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, uyyodhikaṃ dassanāya gacchathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.13.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.16.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, uyyodhikaṃ dassanāya gacchissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.16.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.18.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.18.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.19.1.pli: “Dirattatirattañce bhikkhu senāya vasamāno uyyodhikaṃ vā balaggaṃ vā senābyūhaṃ vā anīkadassanaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.19.1.eng: ‘If a monk who is staying with an army for two or three nights goes to a battle, a troop review, a massing of the army, or a troop inspection, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.1.eng: If a monk who is staying with an army for two or three nights:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.2.eng: he is staying for two or for three nights.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.6.pli: ettakā hatthī, ettakā assā, ettakā rathā, ettakā pattī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.6.eng: so many elephants, so many horses, so many chariots, so much infantry.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.8.pli: ito hatthī hontu, ito assā hontu, ito rathā hontu, ito pattikā hontu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.8.eng: the elephants should set out from here; the horses should set out from here; the chariots should set out from here; the infantry should set out from here.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.10.eng: an elephant troop, a horse troop, a chariot troop, an infantry troop.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.11.pli: Tayo hatthī pacchimaṃ hatthānīkaṃ, tayo assā pacchimaṃ assānīkaṃ, tayo rathā pacchimaṃ rathānīkaṃ, cattāro purisā sarahatthā pattī pacchimaṃ pattānīkaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.11.eng: The smallest troop of elephants is three elephants; the smallest troop of horses is three horses; the smallest troop of chariots is three chariots; the smallest troop of infantry is four men with arrows in hand.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.12.eng: If he is on his way to see it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.13.eng: Wherever he stands to see it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.14.pli: Dassanūpacāraṃ vijahitvā punappunaṃ passati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.14.eng: Every time he goes beyond the range of sight and then sees it again, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.2.1.eng: If he is on his way to see one division of a fourfold army, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.2.2.eng: Wherever he stands to see it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.2.3.pli: Dassanūpacāraṃ vijahitvā punappunaṃ passati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.2.3.eng: Every time he goes beyond the range of sight and then sees it again, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.3.2.eng: if he sees it while standing in a monastery;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.3.3.pli: bhikkhussa ṭhitokāsaṃ vā nisinnokāsaṃ vā nipannokāsaṃ vā āgantvā sampahāro dissati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.3.3.eng: if the army comes to where the monk is standing, sitting, or lying down, and he then sees fighting;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.3.4.eng: if he sees it while walking in the opposite direction;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.3.5.eng: if he goes because there is something to be done, and he then sees it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.3.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.3.9.eng: The training rule on battles, the tenth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.3.10.eng: The fifth subchapter on naked ascetics is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.3.15.eng: Army, and struck: those are the ten.”
